title: Strengthening Hospitality Practical Competencies: Biochemical Non-Covalent Interaction Learning—Productive Failure vs. Explicit Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Ability to understand basic biochemistry concepts (intermediate level)
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners classify four types of non-covalent interactions (hydrogen bonding, ionic bonding, van der Waals forces, hydrophobic interactions) with ≥85% accuracy using VR simulation
Learners achieve ≥70% success rate in solving biochemistry problems by applying pedagogy (PS-I or I-PS) matched to prior knowledge levels
Learners create a 5-minute VR presentation explaining how non-covalent interactions influence protein structure formation through team projects
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
